title: Why do people one trick pony a champion to a certain elo
body:
And then once they get there throw that out the window and start feeding their brains out with someone different?

The only reason you are at that elo is because you are good at that one champ... don't make the entire rest of your team suffer because you wanna first time a champ you don't play in ranked

replies.body:
I don't get that, because unless you're playing something lower ELO's won't learn to counter (Heimer) then you're just giving up your skill. 

Playing a champ a lot makes you a better player. Play what you like and don't worry about knowing everything about every champ. Have a pool of 5 to 10 and rotate one or two out every so often.

Well yes, that's exactly what I'm doing right now. But please, not in Ranked.

I OTP'ed Garen from B3 to G5, and now I'm learning new Champs, but I'm doing it in Normals...
The problem is that Normals isn't as competitive, you're not at the same elo. Normals are good like 10 games or so to get general strategy down, but after that you should really switch to ranked.

Well, sorry, but after 15 games on Ekko, I'm still not able to play it reliably in Gold5, like I play my Garen with 400 games. I'm not going back to Ranked yet, and I'll stay in Normals a bit longer x)
It's because since ranked became DQ practicing a champ in norms  holds next to no merit. Might as well ranked and get something for it.

Well it's because people generaly want to get to gold, to get their season rewards. 
And playing one champion very well, means it will be Generaly easier to get to said elo because in Low Silver and bronze they almost never counterpick, and at higher silver you will still have much succes with a champion that is really strong when mastered,
Now why does someone one trick after getting to gold is more complicated.
Maybe because he only likes to play that champ.
Maybe because he is too lazy/doesn't have time to learn a new main/alt.
Maybe because he is doing well despite being a otp.
Because at a certain point the champion you are OTP'ing can no longer carry you because people know how to deal with it.

Because its the fastest way to climb?

Most people including myself rank with a pretty small pool of champions.  I got Darius, Renekton, Jax, Viktor as champs that I can play to their full potential. When I get to diamond then Imma slowly expand in to more champions but until then its best to climb with your 1-5 One trick pony champions.
I don't even think you need to expand your pool, there are quite some Challenger / Master otps
or mechanically we are decent. I pretty much play xerath exclusively at my elo, but will occasionally play a new champ. Not like i get my ass handed to me but i'm not dominate either.

yea so you are detracting from your team because your MMR is based on your skill playing your best champ... you put your team at a large disadvantage

not always, since i main {{champion:101}} good {{champion:105}} {{champion:7}} and {{champion:238}} are anoyying to deal with. Typically requiring my junglers attention. In some match ups i can't always count on my jungler being there 24/7 which is why i may take champions that are different from my usual play style to come out even and help my team out overall. Essentially jungler doesn't have to camp me 24/7 and has a greater possibility of getting the other lanes to snowball.
